Reviews.Title: “Nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: corvette2005
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. However, they say they have wirless internet in all rooms. Not in ours and judging by the number of people sitting in the lobby with their iPads we were not alone. This is the first hotel I have stayed in in my 60 years that did not have ice, not good if you like a cocktail before heading out for the evening. No ice, really?? it's 2012. It also has the usual European shower which no matter how hard you try not to, manages to flood the bathroom floor. Will they ever discover shower doors? If you don't need the net or dodn't need the ice and dodn't mind a flooded bathroom floor then this is a great place. The rooms are large, at least ours was, nicely designed with a good bed, good service and a great loaction in the center of gay Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fading fast”
Reviews.Author: ologhlin
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant. It's all about location. We go back every year. (Stayed here about 5 times). Beds comfy- quite firm, which I like. Quiet location. Furniture is getting tatty and marked. Hangars keep breaking. Not much room to hang clothes up and nowhere to hide suitcase! Wifi rarely works (this hasn't changed in 2 years) which is really annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the location to Schoneberg and the price was only $88 a night during Easter week. This was a perfect location and hotel to stay during the BLF Easter Weekend and only a short walk to the gay area cafes, bars, and clubs. The lobby has a modern and updated feel throughout. Once I arrive to my room I was a little shocked on how small the single room was. The front desk clerk even commented that the room was really small and asked if it would be ok. The room was very nicely appointed and clean but I could barely move around in it do to the size. I had a couple of issues with the room being cold and a tripped breaker but the front desk guy was super helpful and fixed each problem promptly. He even offered to translate a menu to English for me when I wanted to order food…I thought that was really kind and going the extra mile. The wifi in this hotel does not work so well and I frequently heard the hotel staff mention this to other guest. They do however offer a cable to directly connect your computer to the internet free of charge. Overall I felt really comfortable at this hotel and I would absolutely stay here again, however they would have to upgrade to a better wifi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A7Suki
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room, and when we arrive at hotel we get a free upgrade. Hotel is in very good and quiet location. Near the hotel is a good restaurants. The hotel is a 10-minute walk from the Kurfürstendamm shopping boulevard and KaDeWe department store. Near the hotel you can catch Uban and Sban. At any time at the evening, streets are safe in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific little hotel an absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: EnglandHensh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in this hotel and stayed in one of the luxury rooms (no.210 on the 2nd floor) and our friends had the same room on the 4th floor (410). They are the rooms on the website and they're gorgeous! Massive bed, lovely decoration and funky electric window blinds to close the bathroom off from the bedroom. The breakfast is a "continental" one which we enjoyed and you could eat as much as you liked. The staff were really friendly and helpful, the only small negative was the room got a little chilly in the night and I'd have preferred to be able to control the room temperature myself. The hotel is right in the middle of the main gay area with lots of bars and restaurants locally and Nollendorfplatz railway station really is at the end of the next street and only 5 mins easy walk away. I can recommend Blonde as a really friendly bar and Sixties American Diner (opposite the station) for massive portions and delicious food and cocktails! Book this hotel but maybe avoid the cheapest rooms (judging on the other reviews) you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Woodrow72
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in this hotel upon the recommendation of a friend, and regretted it immediately. Our room was tiny and we were unable to adjust the heating, which was turned up much too high. Aside from that, i don't know what was worse- the unusual stains we discovered on the decorative cushions or the fact we could clearly hear our neighbours' sexual activities through the wall. On both sides. I love Berlin, however on this occasion i was very happy to check out and travel home.

Reviews.Title: “So so Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KobiC2
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel in a lesuire matter so we were totaly open minded! The hotel is in a nice area which close to all the gay's community places. One of the main reasons that we booked the hotel was the Free WiFi that mentioned on the booking.com site. when we arrived to the hotel they told me that they do have it but only at the lobby and not at the upper floors. the gave us a 3rd floor room so we had no wifi. we went to the reception and after a long disscusion with the hotel manager the asked from us 20euros more to move to another room at the ground floor which was classefied as a "executive" room (???) the room was a nice one but had wifi (thanks god). The carpet was dirty, the electronic curtain that billed between the bathroom and the room was stuck at the middle and ... you can understand how it feels!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: AusverGeorge
Reviews.Content: I arrive in the middle of a street festival but got a very nice welcome from staff. Room was pretty and well appointed, despite the small size. I was on ground floor but had a nice garden view, very relaxing and quiet. I really liked the hotel, it's a pity I just could stay there for one night but will no doubt to stay again next time I'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “'Interesting' location - Good base - No more”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: Paid €114 for a double room, arrived at 5pm and was given a room where 2 people with bags could not stand in at the same time. Forked out another €25 to 'upgrade' and were given a regular sized double room. So it started out bad and we became a bit picky but at €140/$190 with no breakfast included I felt it was all a bit rich for what i was getting. 'Interesting location' - the Hotel is located in a gay district of Berlin so therefore there are plenty - I mean plenty - of gay clothing shops displaying their 'wares', gay bars and clubs nearby. Our friend was offered 'sex' by a street worker as he came to join us in a wine bar on Maaßenstraße. I didn't know whether to laugh or cry! Good location - it's beside the U-bahn, KaDeWe and plenty of restaurants Externally the hotel looks great. Inside, the open plan space combining reception, lounge area and breakfast room hints that you will not be hanging around here more so just sleeping here. Going upstairs you find the corridors are very narrow and resulting walls being chipped and worn. The cleaning staff have no room to manoeuvre their trolleys or place their fresh towels or sheets. The result is a visual unwelcoming mess. In the bedroom the white carpet was manky with stains, nearly all the furniture was chipped and worn, the complimentary bathroom cosmetics were half filled/used and one of the towels was ripped. All these small things coming at once made a poor impression. Lastly, the following morning while my wife was showering, her hair full of shampoo, the hot and cold water suddenly stopped for a full 20 minutes. That was the last straw for my wife and she complained to the manager and he agreed and offered a 50% refund. In summary the hotel staff were very kind and understanding, the hotel itself just needs some TLC and it would be a great spot. Just beware of those tiny rooms - they really shouldn't be allowed to offer them as doubles.

Reviews.Title: “For what it is - just ok. Don't have high expectations”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights for a short pleasure trip. I shared the room with a close friend. When you enter the l obby on street level, the hotel appears to be modern and with more of a design flair. Keep in mind this is still a mid range hotel, not a luxury or boutique hotel. So as long as you go in with that expectation, you will probably be mildly satisfied. You should know that the rooms are SMALL. I had one of the larger rooms which I had booked way in advance so it was ok for two people. It was a triple room. However. The triple simply mean two people could be on the main bed, and the third would be on the pull out sofa. This was actually called the "luxury triple" - I do not know what made this a luxury room. The television was an older model, not the LCD flat panel shown on the web site, so that was misleading. This particular room was in the basement, and they have 3 or 4 other rooms down there - there are half windows that bring in light from the street but the rooms are basically darker. The furnishings are showing signs of wear and tear. There is a safe in the closet and a small minibar. There was no bottle opener to open any of the bottles (they are not pop tops). The air conditioning was iffy at best too. I finally said something to the front desk and they said that it may have been turned off. Once she checked, it seemed to work fine, so double check that if you think it is not working - it may simply have been shut off from the master controls. The bathroom was ok. They have a large toiletry dispenser that contains the shower/body gel as one type of gel. I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel ever. Yu can pay €10 per person daily if you decide to do so, but there are so many great places to get food in the neighborhood that you don't need to worry. Wifi is free, but it had several problems through the days I stayed whee it would just simply go off. I travel with a small travel wifi router that plugs into a wall socket for a LAN connection as an alternative that usually works fine - in this case, the hotel did have wall jacks for a LAN connection so I solved the problem for myself. The front desk staff has been good about calling taxis. But beyond that, you should probably have your own tours and guidebooks pre-arranged. The location is very convenient to shops, Restaurants and not far from KaDeWe department store. You can easily walk there. It is also close to the Ubahn stop at Nollendorfplatz. All in all, this was an ok hotel for the price, location, and amenities. It wasn't luxury, but it wasn't a dump either. Would I stay here again? I might consider it, but I will also check out some of the newer hotels opening up in the area that are in the same star rating category as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: TattooedStu
Reviews.Content: I was a little dubious about staying here after reading some of these reviews., but decided to go for it having reserved directly at Eur 210 for 4 nights. The hotel is a short walk from Nollendorfplatz U-Bahn, right in the heart of the gay neighbourhood. There are some lovely buildings, cafes and restaurants nearby. Lovely clean, modern lobby with leather chairs and free wi-fi (code from reception). Staff very friendly and checked in no problem. My room was on the 4th floor, so nice and quiet. High quality and a lovely 'wet room' stone tiled bathroom. However, be warned that the room (with double bed) is TINY. It was just about OK on my own, but I wouldn't want to share with another person. There is free internet access in room, but not wireless - be warned and bring an ethernet cable. Nice LCD TV, wardrobe containing mini-bar and air con which actually worked well (was 32C during my visit and it worked well). I didn't bother with breakfast having been out late, and the local cafes are so good. Maid service excellent, but be warned she starts at 8am and you will be woken by the clatter against the wooden floors. I left at 5am for an early flight, no hassle checking out and the guy ordered me a taxi which arrived in under a minute. I would recommend this hotel, but probably worth paying for a bigger room next time!

Reviews.Title: “"average"”
Reviews.Author: lexyleod
Reviews.Content: In a good central location, this “design” hotel had a contemporary style with artistic features, but was more of a city-centre pension, and did not have some of the amenities of a normal hotel, such as a bar or restaurant, although a modest buffet breakfast (or coffee at other times) was available in the combined reception / tv lounge / breakfast-tables area. Like many rooms apparently, ours was very small and cramped for a double room (and even as a single room), but in some ways it was rather cosy. It was on the top floor with a skylight window. The bathroom was updated, but the first morning the water in the shower kept fading to a trickle (and water leaked under the glass shower-screen onto the bathroom floor). There was a bath-tub, but it took forever to fill sufficiently. The air-conditioning unit didn’t work properly and it was uncomfortably warm the first night, but the weather got cooler the following days, so it didn’t matter so much. We brought these problems to the attention of the reception staff, who were friendly and said it would be attended to, but it didn’t seem that it was. Later, the remote-control for the tv also stopped working (maybe batteries), but the tv set could be operated directly. However, there was a room-safe that did work properly and easily (which has sometimes been a problem in other hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Very uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: mubis
Reviews.Content: The rooms ate so small you can not move in the room, no space to put your luggage. Wi-fi is not working at the rooms, breakfast is so poor. Stuff are nice overall but breakfast room is not enough. They charge for water that you want at the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Gay boys Paradise”
Reviews.Author: xxxdarren
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this room sooooooo many times, and I will not change to any other, Love the gay clubs, bars near by, the chineese take way opposite is so good, All the staff are sooo friendly and always willing to help, Free internet in this hotel, which is very importnat. They serve breakfats, but i never take it as i am too drunk at that time. Tram stop 10 min walk, If your a Gay and have good taste, choose this hotel. Promise you will not regret. Paris P.S Every one at quinting see you soon, mwah P.P.S Really good beauty spa that does really good faials, Benny durro opposite to the hotel, and also a good gym near the hotel

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT CHOOSE THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian38
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever experienced. Dirty carpet. Water all over the bathroom. Ventilation did not work. Room small and not cozy. Poor breakfast. Do not choose this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing went right”
Reviews.Author: gsfgraeme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of its central location as I was in Berlin to run the Berlin Marathon. I was shocked at the unfriendly and uncompromising behaviour of the staff from start to finish. They insisted on immediate payment on arrival in full without giving me an opportunity to view the rooms. Although I was running on Sunday so needed to load on carbohydrates, the staff refused to warm up porridge or to bread available so I had to go out and buy a kettle, bowl and spoon the day before which made the trip unnecessarily stressful. It demonstrated that you could not rely on the staff for anything. The rooms were overpriced at 125 euros per night and although advertised as a 4 star on booking.com, I have found more pleasant and better staffed pension houses in France and Italy. The lobby had no bar and the breakfast was very poor quality, that is when it was available. The rooms were not practical. There was insufficient drawer and cupboard space so I had to live out of my suitcase. The bathroom and bedroom too small. The shower leaked in the bathroome. There was no soap in the bathroom. There was no kettle in the room. The bed had and uncomfortable mattress with ill fitting bed linen. The carpets were stained and dirty. The room was hot and uncomfortable. Frankly, this hotel made my stay a miserable experience although I had paid a handsome price! This hotel urgently needs to be reclassified so that other travellers do not suffer the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “Okay once you know how to book here and lower your expectations”
Reviews.Author: RobDiplomat
Reviews.Content: It's the 3rd time I have stayed at this hotel and some things in life you can just learn to live with or change them. For the price of 85 Euros for 2 persons a night for a Luxury room they claim but I pay no attention to that cause all rooms are the same except location and the time you booked the reservation. Book on the 4th floor if available away from the elevator is the way to go. To book here you have to book about a month in advance and book directly with the hotel's website. I was able to take a hot bath at night after a long day in Berlin, the rooms are clean; except the carpets are nasty looking due to them being WHITE and after 5 years of being in business you can image a WHITE carpet in a hotel room. There was also lots of DUST! I wish they would do a better job and dust the place more due Berlin being a dusty windy city. Now in the middle of the Summer I would never stay in this HOTEL because the A/C never works and the owners of the hotel keep it regulated where if you are lucky you may get a fan breeze coming thru. In Spring and Winter its fine so you make the call if you can live with a dirty white carpet, nice interior away from the elevators, great location for 85 euros a night plus lousy Breakfast for 10 Euros more, it's up to you to make that call. And for 75 euros you can get the economy room on the first floor near the elevator if you want to save 10 bucks.......Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “BAD BAD BAD...a rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: Ellagri
Reviews.Content: Apparently hotels do get stars (this one obviously has 4!) just for design reasons, even though everything else just sucks. I was in Berlin to attend a fair - like many others who showered at 7 a.m. So the shower water facilities went on strike...I asked myself, are we in some meditterranean country where water problems are said to be more common or in the German capital Berlin?! Further, as I read in other reviews...there were constant problems with the internet connection in the rooms. What a shame! And nobody cared! As well nobody cared (I called the reception several times) that my bed table phone didn't work. The breakfast was poor and just 'loveless'. And yes I have never slept that bad before in my life in a row...the beds are too hard (and I usually like hard mattresses!) and the hotel is awfully noisy. Additionally I had bad luck with a room near the elevator. All in all over-priced window-washing! I wonder how this hotel has already been in business for 5 years! Obviously there is people who don't care much about certain standards, service and basic comfort (yes, a working shower in the morning for 150 Euro a night!!!) but only for trendy design...

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room in a nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelAlex_Greece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a nice area 5 min walk from the tube station and all the shops icluding Kadewe. It's a nice clean hotel though the room we stayed at was very tiny so we couldn't even open our suitcase. The bathroom was small too and the bed was tiny!! I am 1.75 tall and so was the bad. Anyone taller wouldn't fit. It was the economy standard room and with that price we expected something bigger. We were told that there were some bigger rooms but it would cost more! How bigger?? That, I don't Know. If the room was bigger so we could move, my experience would have been satisfying ... now I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “easter time/stay 2010 at the Quintin hotel”
Reviews.Author: hugodegroot
Reviews.Content: arriving on the 1st of April 2010 for a 4 day easter-break and booked for the first (and last) time at the Quintin ("design") hotel. I checked in; girl was friendly at the desk..I enquirted about possibility of internet and she issued me a cable for the computor. When I got to my room, I was disapointed to find a smaal tiny room with only kind of side/sky light window...also room did not look clean. Could not find the socket for the inernet cable. I called receptiond desk (same girl who issued me the cable at c.i.) and she said- " o that room does not have an inernet socket/connection" I asked for an other room and she said to come down to get the key for a new room. Packed everything again went downstairs (no appologies...) went to my new room....also small and not clean, in the bathroom and bahroom tiles crumbled.....Found the socket for the internet but could not get a connection...went downstairs to reception again (same girl) and told her inernet is not working...O you can then go to an inernet cafe was the answer.......Long story short...the inernet connection did not work at all for the 4 days we stayed there. Wanted to chenge the hotel but as I paid for complete stay when checking in, the reception staff could not guarantee pay back of complete amount. I could speak to the manager was their advise. They suggested him to cal me..I gave my tel number but was never called. Met many hotel guests who also were complaining about non availability of internet. Breakfast is very sober...orange juice kind of watery lemonade..... As there is only 1 elevator in the hotel whic is also used for the service staff it can take ges before the elevator reacvhers your floor. Hotel also very noise..you hear every footstep upstairs. For late check out (3 hrs later)~ they wanted to charge me 20 euros extra ....Requeste dto have the room cleaned on sunday but this never happened aswell. A rather disaponting experience as my expectations were quite high. Anyhow never again will ~I stay here again at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: zodys
Reviews.Content: I stayed in that hotel for five days.The rooms that we took were very small and you can hardly walk around the room,but the design of the hotel were superb.Some lack of closet is a problem,we didn't unpack all of our clothes because we didn't have enough space. The bathroom was very nice,with all the nesecary materials such as toothpaste,shampoo etc.The only thing that they didn't have was hairdryer,and i thing that they have to put some. In our friends room a problem with the shower occured and they fix it immediatly. i ve noticed that the have bigger rooms and they are not more expensive than ours. We didn't ate breakfast so i cant review on that. The facilities of the hotel were very nice,the garden,free wifi internet in each room. the lady that was cleaning our room were very kind and very good at her job. Also the prices of the mini bar were very cheap according to other hotels that i ve been. The area is quiet but not for families because is gay friendly. Overall is a nice hotel,very close to city center,with all the public transportation near and very cheap 60 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBoyLondon
Reviews.Content: A few of the reviews here are overly negative and perhaps a little old. The place looks very new, amazed anyone thinks the place is tired. Location is very convenient while being on a nice quiet street. Staff were perfectly helpful, perhaps not as obsequious as some people would like but efficient - as we were in town for the marathon they even kindly made our porridge for us on the morning of the marathon! However, other reviewers are accurate about the fact the shower lets water all over the bathroom floor whenever you take a shower which is just down to poor design - surely they could sort this out? Rooms are also a little on the small side, but not overly so for Europe. I'd recommend this place - its also very well priced for Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “You won't get what they promised you.”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest100
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in a lot of hotels in Berlin. This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. I booked a room for a week. Upon arrival, you have to pay the whole stay, they charge your credit card immediately. The rooms are small (mine was and I saw even smaller rooms) and the carpet was very dirty. Though it was a double room, I don't know how you would survive a week in that room and with that bathroom. The bathroom is also very small and run down, the paint was chipping away . When taking a shower, the bathroom would flood,and everything would get wet, there was defenitely something wrong with the whole set-up. Quiet often there was no hot water. You had to call reception and they would fix the problem, but you should not be in a hurry. I thought the beds were very uncomfortable, very hard, like sleeping on a wooden board. In a double room you only get one bedlamp, so only one person can read. The furnishings looked tired and dilapidated. The biggest problem was, that the aircon was not switched on. It was unbearably warm in my room. I asked reception several times to switch on the aircon, but they did not do so. I stayed with friends in this hotel, their rooms were also unbearably warm and they also asked for the aircon to be switched on. Nothing happend. After five days in this hotel it was enough, I checked out. I did not get a refund for the last two nights. I will never stay in this hotel of in hotels of this group again. Guests are not important to this hotel, they could not care less.

Reviews.Title: “Hot sauna room”
Reviews.Author: Poelie
Reviews.Content: NIce place from the outside and lobby looks nice, however room was incredibly small, you could hardly walk around the bed. On top of that the airconditioning did not seem to work despite request at reception to fix it. Breakfast very simple. Would not recommend it and will not come again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxxdarren
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on the 7th of November for 2 nights, Its was my first time to berlin, Before traveling I rang the hotel and asked if they knew any there I could have a Facial or Massage, staff told me No they didn't, So any ways I did my own research and found a Fantasric place opposite the Hotel. I did like the deco in the hotel, I stayed in Room 308, 85 euro a night, White carpet a bit dirty, when in the shower water get everywhere, Bath take ages to fill, even thought its a bouble room and a double bed, they put 2 single blankets on the beds, when asked staff told me thats this is how they do it in Belin, No Iron and boars in room, when asked they didn't have any as they only have one Iron and board in the hole hotel. (4 star Hotel) They do not serve any hot food at night time, Hotel it self was a nice hotel, staff customer service not very good, There are other hotels in the area which I will choose next time.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever!”
Reviews.Author: slecombre
Reviews.Content: Very small room, dirty carpet, small shower with water going everywhere in the bathroom. No service, breakfast is a joke. AND: check-out at 11am on sunday (great after a night in Berghain!) On the plus side, it is close to the gay area of Berlin. One question: why do they call themselves "design hotel"?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: DavidA_1982
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Quentin Design Hotel during a holiday to Berlin. The hotel is in a quiet residential area in the Schöneburg area of Berlin, near Nollendorfplatz U-Bahn station. Housed in an old, five-storey building this modern hotel has recently been renovated throughout and is furnished to a high standard. Our room was a luxury double on the fifth floor, which was in the roof of the building. The room had a large, comfortable bed, flat screen television and well appointed bathroom. The mini-bar was reasonably priced; the wardrobe contained a safe and although not very big, there was plenty of storage for clothes there and in two sets of drawers. Standard double rooms are slightly smaller. The bathroom had a large window into the bedroom, which contained an electronically-controlled venetian blind for privacy. Although a nice design feature, allowing lots of light into the bathroom, we kept the blinds closed all of the time. The hotel only caters for breakfast; we chose not to eat in the hotel, preferring to find something whilst out during the day. Breakfast would likely be the usual continental/German affair: cold meats, cheese, cereals, croissants and fruit. The hotel doesn’t have a bar. The area around Nollendorfplatz is widely regarded as Berlin’s gay hotspot although Berlin is a pretty easy-going city anyway. Near to the hotel are plenty of bars and restaurants, as well as more “specialist” gay venues. That is not to say the area is at all seedy - the relaxed nature of the city means these places are dotted all over the city. The U-bahn at Nollendorfplatz is served by three lines giving easy access to the rest of Berlin. The journey from here to Potsdamer Platz is approximately 10 minutes by U-bahn. The Ku’damm, Berlin’s famous shopping street similar to Oxford Street in London is a 10 minute walk away. Our room was €135 per night. We booked directly with the hotel via their web site as their prices were, strangely, slightly cheaper than those offered by the usual booking sites. If you’re planning a trip to Berlin I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location, comfortable design rooms,wow !!!”
Reviews.Author: divinidylle
Reviews.Content: It is the second time I stayed here and was not disappointed again. Nice clean rooms, nice comfortable bed and bathroom (with tootbrush, etc....), nice reception and the hotel is in a quiet street It is 2 minutes walk of the gay scene for those interested. I just have to point out that some Single rooms are located on the ground floor. I mention this because some people (like me) do not like to sleep on ground floors. To finish, it is just a few minutes walk away from the KADEWE mall :-))

Reviews.Title: “No Refunds Even If Their Fault”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii-Fan-from-LA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a policy that if you leave early, they will keep all your money. They make you prepay the entire stay. Be very careful. In my room, things kept breaking down, such as the plumbing and the air conditioning when it was very hot, which made it impossible to sleep at night. I had paid for 5 nights there. I told the front desk I wanted to check out after day 2 being tired of all the problems. They said they'd keep all my money. Another reviewer has commented on this about this hotel. Talking to the supervisor was of no help either. So I stayed the other nights rather than lose the money but BEWARE. Even if your room is totally uninhabitable, for example the toilet overflowing, they will keep all your money if you leave. I have stayed in all types of hotels from one star to 5 star, and never before encountered a management so hostile to the guests. The staff seemed nice but somewhat demoralized, which I can understand considering the management. Also, the rooms can be noisy from neighboring rooms and mine filled up often with cigarette smoke from other rooms on the floor. There are no "non smoking" floors. The location is good, but not worth the problems. There is a Best Western a few blocks away on An der Urania that is great in the business section and about the same price. When I moved over there I slept well and was much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good loction”
Reviews.Author: jezmond
Reviews.Content: This hotel served our needs perfectly for the type of holiday we wanted. Group of friends out to have some good food and good time. Good location, close to a wide range of gay bars (not very female friend although). For the price we paid we felt it was good value. We booked three rooms. One of us got a room with a Balcony which was fantastic. The others where smaller in comparison but still a good size. Staff were friendly and polite. Didn't really need much help but everything went smoothly. If you are looking for a hotel in the heart of the gay district then this is a good place to stay. Some really nice restaurants in the area and close by to the shops!

Reviews.Title: “Great nightlife location!”
Reviews.Author: GiancarloRoma
Reviews.Content: Overall value: 22/25 - LOCATION (5pts): in the heart of the western nightlife and shopping area (KaDeWe), walking distance from main metro/train stops; - SERVICE (3pts): simple, (no more than one person at the reception); - ROOM (4pts): modern design, a little bit small for a “suite” style room; - BATH ROOM (4pts): ery nice but no hairdryer; - BUILDING (4pts): beginning of century style; - BONUS: price (dbl at 130€ per night during the weekend).

Reviews.Title: “very fine rooms in a very friendly neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: pop101_dk
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel and where very pleased with the room. The decor where fine and the was clean. The daily cleaning was superb and the reception friendly and precise. It was easy to get in/out at the hotel at all times. The price we got where very low for a three nights stay. The neighborhood was friendly, with good dining/wining opportunities and close to public transportation. We read the mixed reviews before booking the hotel and would say that the bed is very good and hard, the hot water was instantly, the white carpets where used and could be changed during the next 12 months and the people in hall could be a little bit noisy. Bottomline; we would come back again another time :-)

Reviews.Title: “might happen you do not get what you have booked”
Reviews.Author: Lauri_Kurs
Reviews.Content: Pictures on the hotel's webpage are incorrect. I booked a double room (check the webpage, quite fancy) and when I arrived, I got a small room (2.5 X 3 meters) . After complaining, I was told that that's what I booked - an economy double room. But there is not even an option to book an "economy double room" on the webpage, which she did not believe. Luckily I had my laptop so I showed her the webpage - and the pictures that are behind the roomtypes and asked for the room on the picture. That night she had none, but I got a nice large room next night. On checking out there was some trouble with the bill (room was 5 EUR more expensive per night), which was corrected after I pointed it out. What I didn't argue to them was that on the hotel's webpage the rate is 75 EUR, but on the confirmation that I was sent by mail, it was already 79 EUR, and in the end they wanted to charge me 84 EUR. So - always check your confirmations:) which I did only on check out. Since our hopes were quite high (based on the picture on the webpage) we were very disappointed the first night. The small room wasn't bad, but I hoped to get something else. If they have more of these rooms, they could just sell it as a SGL or make an extra option to book an "economy double room" to the webpage with the picture of it. Good things are - 1. reasonable rates 2. free WiFi 3. closeness to the centre 4. cheap mini-bar 5. nice rooms (if you get what you have booked) Bad thing - 1. you have to prove that you are nor a camel. Staff is not very service minded.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Andrej_and_Bea
Reviews.Content: LOCATION Hotel is in excellent location near U-bahn (Nollendorfplatz), near KaDeWe and Kurfürstendamm avenue. U-Bahn tickets you can buy directly at the station, it is good to buy Berlin Welcome Card or City Tour Card as you will receice some discounts also in museums, etc. On the other hand it is on very quiet street. Parking is available in front of the hotel if you are lucky to find a free place (it is for free). Or there is a parking building nearby (cca 100m) contracted by hotel for 10€ per day. HOTEL Hotel is very modern and stylish. Staff is helpful. It is exactly like on the hotel official pictures. ROOM There are many disputes about the rooms. First again it is exactly like on the hotel official pictures. If you like modern design you will definitely like it. Window between bathroom and bedroom is excellent. We had no problem with the hot water as it was mentioned in other reviews and hot water was available anytime after few seconds. It is true that the doors slams loudly and there is a wooden floor on the hallway. We knew that from the reviews so we tried to walk silently and do not slam the doors. Wherever you stay it is always about tolerance to you neighbors. We had no problem and didn’t hear any noise and did not wake up in the night. The beds are nice and not hard as there was a complaint in another previous review. It is true that carpet has some stains. But it is not really dirty and it is cleaned by house keepers, but it will be a miracle to keep white carpet white forever in a hotel. BREAKFAST The breakfast is in the hotel lobby. Buffet is good but serve not many options. After few days it start to be boring and you will need some change. It is even worse if you come late as your choice is even more diminished. Don't worry, there are many restaurants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely design hotel”
Reviews.Author: smos
Reviews.Content: great design hotel with original bathroom. Price/quality good score; Not far away from the Kurfurstendamm and lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood. Metro at 200 metres. Will book again if i visit berlin.

Reviews.Title: “I liked It!”
Reviews.Author: I'mcomingback
Reviews.Content: I booked the Quentin Design Hotel with some trepidation. I knew that I wanted to stay in Schoneberg and I thought that this hotel looked like the nicest in this district. However it had some poor reviews here on TA. I decided to take a chance and I'm happy that I did. I was very pleasantly surprised. This is a really nice hotel and very stylish. The lobby and rooms are very nice. They are decorated in a modern design. Simple and clean lined furniture and some cool details. The bathroom has a window into the bedroom. It had electric blinds in between the panes of glass to close the two rooms off from one another. There is a mirror on rollers that rolls from the back of the tub along the bathroom wall. This way you can position it where ever you want it. The hotel is very clean and well taken care of. I found the staff to be very nice and professional. They were always helpful. When I asked if they knew the weather forecast for the next day the receptionist immediately looked it up online. When I mentioned I would be checking out the next morning the receptionist offered to order a car for me. These may not seem like huge things but after some of the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. Some of the negative things that I read here I will partially agree with. One, The floor in the hallway is wood. You do sometimes hear people on your floor walking down the hall. Also, I did occasionally hear other peoples doors slam. Two, The beige carpet in my room was a bit dirty. I found everything else very, very clean. All of the furnishings were in excellent condition. I personally don't think that it is anything more than light carpeting in an area with heavy traffic.The last thing was the hot water. The water didn't always come out hot immediately. However it never took more than a few minutes of letting it run to get hot water. This hotel is in a really charming area. There are several restaurants within a short walk. The nearest train is about a 5 minute walk away. I was easily able to get everywhere from this train stop. I would certainly recommend this hotel and I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerrier7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quentin Design Hotel back in September. I could not fault our room. The design was absolutely gorgeous and the double bed was massive and so comfy. I loved the stylish bathroom too. The staff were friendly and helpful. Although based in the gay district I found the location to be pretty central and quite close to one of the major shopping districts. I got a very good price for the room too so overall great value. I would definitely stay here again if I went back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: Biker2006
Reviews.Content: Even the locals expect poor customer service in Germany but this hotel managed to give the worst service I have ever experienced in the country. Just because the place looks pretty doesn't mean it's any good. - The rooms are so small you have to put your bags on top of the wardrobe - There is a wait of up to 10 minutes for hot water - The doors of the rooms slam so loudly that you get woken up several times in the night by your neighbours - The beds are so hard it is like sleeping on the floor. Two of us, in two different rooms both asked if all the beds in the hotel were the same, in the hope of being able to ask to change rooms. Instead of a sympathetic smile and a "sorry, they are all the same" we got "it's a matter of taste" and a smirk. When we then said we would leave a day early because we couldn't stand another night longer we were told to "tell my colleague in the morning". I asked the receptionist if she would leave her colleague a message but it seems she didn't. The beds are really really hard. I couldn't get much sleep and was so stiff in the morning I could barely bend down to put my shoes on. Then we came to check out we were expected to pay for the night we weren't going to use and told rudely that "if you book a package holiday to Mallorca and go home early you don't expect a refund". I explained politely that the hotel was not a package holiday to Mallorca and that we were not satisfied with the beds and had been forced to look for other accommodation. Eventually our bills were adjusted - extremely reluctantly. The worst point came however, when another guest who was waiting at reception tried to ask a very quick question. The receptionist glared at him like a schoolteacher would look at a naughty child and told him to wait. I felt sorry for him and almost apologised for the receptionist's attitude. The only good thing about this hotel is the location and the housekeeper who was very friendly. However I can only recommend her to find another place to work before the hotel closes down. If they continue treating guests like this they will go out of business very soon. Don't go to this hotel is the bottom line.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: sanfrantraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, and in a good location if you are gay - next to the gay district. The decor is nice, a Chinese theme, however the lightly colored carpet had huge stains on it. We got a good price. There isn't much to this hotel other than the rooms, but that was okay for us. There was free internet access in the lobby. The bathroom is nice although not really big enough for two people to be in it at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Honour
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel during ITB. It had been recommended by some colleagues and so I thought it would be nice to stay in the same place.. All single rooms had been taken and the only one available was what they called a triple. As I was due to share with another colleague I assumed that with the room being sold as a triple this would include an extra bed but asked for another one anyway. It was then that I was then informed there would be an additional charge per night for the extra bed. Something I could not understand as a triple would imply it could sleep 3 people. In any case on arrival having requested an extra bed, it was not in the room and when my colleague asked for it to be brought up the hotel staff enquired whether we could not share a bed rather... A totally lazy attitude especially as I had already been charged the extra rate. The room itself was quite spacious considering we were sharing but having seen our colleagues' rooms these were extremely small for the price they were paying. In fact one of our colleagues actually checked out as he had asked if laundry could be done having flown from the other side of the world and was told he should bring it to the laundry himself. I just felt lucky that I got a slightly larger room sharing with someone else. Service is something I don't even know where to begin to comment on.. There is none. They will not do anything additional for you. Staff all seem to feel they are too good to be there. You cannot even get through to them on email and they will certainly take at least 2 weeks to respond... When I had some problems there was a real reluctance to help and I was told quite honestly that it was not their problem. When you fly across the world and pay quite a lot of money for a hotel the least you would expect is some decent service. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: traveldawg
Reviews.Content: The Quentin is in a perfect location if you want to explore the Schoneberg area of Berlin, and is handy to two metro stops as well. The hotel is the Saturday Night Live skit 'Sprockets' come to life. Bring your black turtleneck and be prepared for tons of attitude. Furnishings are very nice and the bathroom is spacious, but even for european hotels, rooms are very cramped with barely room for your luggage. The biggest complaint with the Quinten is that it really isn't as nice as the image it portrays. For the attitude given, you aren't in turn taken care of very well. One important thing to note - walls are paper thin and all floors in the hallway are hardwood, so the noise of someone just walking down the hall reverberates loudly through your room, as does the loud bang of the doors - loud enough to wake you from sleep (and I'm a heavy sleeper). And the housekeeping staff bangs and yells incessantly while cleaning nearby rooms. if you hope to sleep late in the morning, you won't. But hey, the furniture is nice. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed in the Quentin Design Hotel from 23rd to 27th February 2006 and thoroughly enjoyed it. The Hotel is in a superb loaction, very central and close to the Kurfurstendamm. The gay nigtlife of Shoneberg in the Fuggerstrabe area is just around the corner and the Hotel itself is in a very quiet (mainly residential) street. The rooms are very modern, with comfortable large beds, soft pillows and an LCD television. Bathrooms are also very modern with bath & shower and a nice selection of toiletries and soft towells. Breakfast consists of a buffet continental selection of meats, cheese, breads etc. All very fresh & plentiful. Only criticism is lack of atmosphere in the buffet area - far too quiet! Also, the Hotel would benefit from being re-arranged so that the guests eating area wasn't next to the reception desk. Overall I would say that this hotel would appeal to singles, couples and gays and those who are particular about their surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoxsmumMelbourne
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The staff are fantastic, speak great english and cannot help you enough. Free internet access is a huge bonus. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the main shopping drag, about the same to the closest train station. The hotel is located in the 'gay' part of town but this did not worry us. The room was a good size and the bathrrom very modern and clean. Breakfast was not included in our room rate of $205 AUS per night but we just popped out to local cafes etc. The only thing missing from this hotel is a gym. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Quentin Design hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 12 Kalckreuthstrasse, 10777 Berlin, Germany
